axioms.name: Group Definition
axioms.statement: A group is a set G equipped with an operation * satisfying closure, associativity, existence of identity, and existence of inverses.

axioms.name: Abelian Group Definition
axioms.statement: A group (G, *) is Abelian if for all a, b in G, a * b = b * a.

axioms.name: Subgroup Criterion
axioms.statement: A subset H of G is a subgroup if it is nonempty and for all a, b in H, ab^{-1} is in H.

axioms.name: Order of an Element
axioms.statement: The order of an element g in G is the smallest positive integer n such that g^n = e, where e is the identity element.

axioms.name: Lagrange's Theorem
axioms.statement: The order of a subgroup H divides the order of the finite group G.

axioms.name: Homomorphism Definition
axioms.statement: A map f: G → H between groups is a homomorphism if for all a, b in G, f(ab) = f(a)f(b).

axioms.name: Kernel of a Homomorphism
axioms.statement: The kernel of a group homomorphism f: G → H is the set of elements g in G such that f(g) = e_H.

axioms.name: First Isomorphism Theorem
axioms.statement: If f: G → H is a group homomorphism, then G/ker(f) ≅ im(f).

axioms.name: Ring Definition
axioms.statement: A ring is a set R with two binary operations, addition and multiplication, such that (R, +) is an abelian group, (R, *) is associative, and multiplication distributes over addition.

axioms.name: Field Definition
axioms.statement: A field is a commutative ring with unity in which every nonzero element has a multiplicative inverse.

axioms.name: Ideal Definition
axioms.statement: An ideal I of a ring R is a subset such that for all r in R and i in I, ri and ir are in I.

axioms.name: Quotient Ring
axioms.statement: Given a ring R and an ideal I, the quotient ring R/I is the set of cosets with addition and multiplication well-defined.

axioms.name: Ring Homomorphism Definition
axioms.statement: A function f: R → S between rings is a homomorphism if f(a + b) = f(a) + f(b) and f(ab) = f(a)f(b).

axioms.name: Integral Domain Definition
axioms.statement: An integral domain is a commutative ring with unity with no zero divisors.

axioms.name: Field of Fractions
axioms.statement: The field of fractions of an integral domain R consists of all elements a/b where a, b are in R and b ≠ 0.

axioms.name: Principal Ideal Domain (PID)
axioms.statement: A PID is an integral domain in which every ideal is principal.

axioms.name: Unique Factorization Domain (UFD)
axioms.statement: A UFD is an integral domain in which every nonzero non-unit element has a unique factorization into irreducibles, up to order and units.

axioms.name: Units in a Ring
axioms.statement: An element u in a ring R is called a unit if there exists v in R such that uv = vu = 1.

axioms.name: Zero Divisor Definition
axioms.statement: An element a ≠ 0 in a ring R is a zero divisor if there exists b ≠ 0 in R such that ab = 0.

axioms.name: Z/nZ Structure
axioms.statement: The set Z/nZ of integers modulo n forms a ring. It forms a field if and only if n is prime.
